column9:
This table shows the Spring 2018 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, broken down by school. It highlights undergraduate and graduate teaching activity, and converts totals into standardized FTE counts.

By School (Spring 2018):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, with 55,277 total credit hours, translating into 3,721 FTEs.

Business – generated 17,094 credit hours, supporting 1,136 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies – contributed 16,659 credit hours, equal to 1,228 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – produced 35,932 credit hours, for 2,446 FTEs.

No School – minimal, at 290 credit hours and 20 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credits taught at each level.

Total Credit Hours – combined undergrad and grad hours.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
